Contradict fact: The expert's verdict contradicts the claim by stating that South African drinkers don't consume more per person on average than anywhere else in Africa.
Understate: The expert's verdict may understate the actual drinking habits of South Africans by stating that only 31% of them drink alcohol.
Lack enough support: The expert's verdict does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the claim that South Africans drink more per person than anywhere else in Africa.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that South Africans drink more per person than anywhere else in Africa without providing sufficient evidence or context.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict does not provide any alternative explanations for the claim.
